You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Specify SEO Metadata for Products and Categories

When setting up your products and categories, complete the appropriate SEO fields for your product and category records. B2B Commerce for Visualforce uses the content from these fields to populate metadata in your bot-enabled Product Detail page and construct friendly URLs.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
Edit on CC Products	Edit on CC Products
To modify CC Category records:	Edit on CC Categories
Complete the SEO fields on your product records.
On the CC Products tab in your org, select a product.
On the product record, scroll to the SEO section.
For SEO Title, enter a value (up to 255 characters) that appears in the <title> in the <head> of the bot-enabled Product Detail page.
NOTE The title appears in external search engine results, the browser’s tab or window title, and bookmarks.
For SEO ID, enter a unique, URL-safe string (up to 255 characters) for the product's friendly URL path, such as EastonMachine.
TIP The SEO ID field doesn't support the following special characters:
!	*	'	(	)	@	&
;	:	+	=	$	,	.
/	?	%	#	[	]	
For SEO Description, enter a description, up to 255 characters.
NOTE This value appears in the content attribute of the <meta name="description"> and <meta property="og:description"> tags in the <head> of the bot-enabled Product Detail page. This description appears in external search engine results.
For SEO Keywords, enter a comma-separated list of search keywords, up to 150 characters.
NOTE The keywords populate the content attribute of the <meta name="keywords"> tag in the <head> of the bot-enabled Product List page. These keywords provide information to search engines, browsers, and web services.
If your storefront supports multiple languages, go to the Product Locale related list and specify an SEO ID value on each Product Item I18N record.
NOTE This value provides the localized friendly URL for users in each supported locale.
Assign a canonical path to one of the product’s categories.
NOTE Because you can assign a product to multiple categories, designate one category as the authoritative path to improve search optimization.
On a product record, go to the Product Categories related list.
Find the category assignment you want to designate as canonical, and click Edit.
Select Canonical Path and save your changes.
TIP

Canonical paths and category assignments can result in some messy product taxonomy. Keep the following tips in mind:

For each product, designate only one category as the canonical path.
If you designate more than one canonical path for a product, B2B Commerce for Visualforce uses the most recently modified category assignment as the canonical path.
If you don’t designate any canonical path for a product, B2B Commerce for Visualforce uses the most recently modified category assignment as the canonical path.
Complete the SEO ID field on all your category records, including top-level and nested categories.
On the CC Categories tab in your org, select a category.
In the SEO ID field, enter a unique, URL-safe string for the category’s friendly URL path, such as Espresso, and save your changes.
TIP Use a unique SEO ID value for each product and category to avoid a situation where a friendly URL resolves to multiple records. For example, if two products specify the same SEO ID and neither has a category assigned, B2B Commerce for Visualforce generates the same friendly URL for both products. Any user following that friendly URL can reach either product.
If your storefront supports multiple languages, go to the CategoryI18N related list and specify an SEO ID value on each CategoryI18N record.

With your product and category SEO fields complete, you’re ready to set up friendly URLs.

SEE ALSO
